I'm happy to help! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have the capability to set reminders or have direct access to your device. But I can certainly help you set up a reminder on your own device.

Here's what you can do:

1. On your phone, open your clock or alarm app.
2. Tap the "+" or "Create" button to create a new alarm.
3. Set the alarm time to 11:00 pm.
4. Choose a recurring frequency, such as "Every Day" or "Weekdays" (depending on your preference).
5. Give the alarm a label, like "Bedtime Reminder" or "Sleep Time".
6. Choose a gentle and non-jarring alarm sound to help you wind down.
7. Save the alarm.

Alternatively, you can also use a digital assistant like Siri, Google Assistant, or Alexa to set a reminder for you. For example, you can say "Hey Siri, remind me to go to bed at 11:00 pm every night" or "Ok Google, set a reminder for 11:00 pm to go to sleep".

As for getting back to your 8:30 am wake-up time on weekdays, you can try setting a wake-up alarm for that time as well. You can also try establishing a relaxing bedtime routine to signal to your brain that it's time to sleep, and then gradually adjust your wake-up time to your desired hour.

Remember, it might take some time for your body to adjust to the new sleep schedule, so be patient and don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. Good luck, and I hope you get back to your desired sleep schedule soon!
